internal.content:
--- title: ST4SD Registry --- import { CodeSyntax } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { NetworkServices } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { CarbonForIbmDotcom } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { Kubernetes } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { Tools } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { FileBackup } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { Reliability } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { ArtTools_01 } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; **ST4SD Registry** provides a web-based UI and command-line tool for working with virtual experiments. The UI allows searching and inspecting virtual experiment packages along with logs and results from when they were executed. The command line tool simplifies creating, modifying and sharing virtual experiment packages with colleagues or the wider community. Anyone can use ST4SD Registry. ## Why ST4SD Registry?
}> The ST4SD Registry provides a powerful yet easy to use UI that enables both novice and expert users to explore available virtual experiments, track their runs, and inspect their outputs. }> The `stp` command line tool provides a conversational-style interface that makes it simple for developers to create and manage virtual experiment packages. }> ST4SD Registry provides strong versioning capabilities by rigorously tracking changes to virtual experiment packages. This enhances reproducibility which is critical in scientific research.
## Try it yourself Download a package from the ST4SD Global Registry via `stp`. `pip install "st4sd-runtime-core[develop]"` then execute: ```bash stp package download https://registry.st4sd.res.ibm.com/registry-ui/experiment/nanopore-geometry-experiment ``` If you have an ST4SD Cloud instance, you can log in to your ST4SD Registry via `stp` and push the package to it: ```bash ST4SD_AUTHENTICATION_ROUTE=$(oc get route st4sd-authentication -o=jsonpath={.spec.host}) stp login $ST4SD_AUTHENTICATION_ROUTE stp package push nanopore-geometry-experiment.json ``` Then visit the URL `stp` outputs to see the experiment in your ST4SD Registry UI. ## Learn more
}> Learn about all the features of the ST4SD Registry UI with a [guided tour](/using-the-virtual-experiments-registry-ui) or visit the [ST4SD Global Registry](https://registry.st4sd.res.ibm.com/) for a first look. }> Use [an interactive Build Canvas and a Graph Library](/build-experiments-registry-ui) to create and modify experiments straight from your browser. }> Learn all that `stp` has to offer and how it can help you when using ST4SD in its [dedicated page](/stp). }> We've distilled many years of experience in creating virtual experiments into a set of [developer best-practices](/virtual-experiment-developer-best-practices).
## Explore other ST4SD technologies
}> **ST4SD Core** enables writing virtual experiments that can run on your laptop, on HPC machines, or on cloud. [Get Started](/st4sd-core-getting-started) }> **ST4SD Cloud** creates and maintains, secure, scalable and robust deployments of ST4SD on OpenShift clusters. [Get Started](/st4sd-cloud-getting-started) }> **ST4SD Services** allows scientists to run virtual experiments and query their data via Jupyter notebooks. It includes a high-performance metadata-store that enables memoization. [Get Started](/st4sd-services-getting-started)

--- title: ST4SD Registry --- import { CodeSyntax } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { NetworkServices } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { CarbonForIbmDotcom } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { Kubernetes } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { Tools } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { FileBackup } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { Reliability } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { ArtTools_01 } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; **ST4SD Registry** provides a web-based UI and command-line tool for working with virtual experiments. The UI allows searching and inspecting virtual experiment packages along with logs and results from when they were executed. The command line tool simplifies creating, modifying and sharing virtual experiment packages with colleagues or the wider community. Anyone can use ST4SD Registry. ## Why ST4SD Registry?
}> The ST4SD Registry provides a powerful yet easy to use UI that enables both novice and expert users to explore available virtual experiments, track their runs, and inspect their outputs. }> The `stp` command line tool provides a conversational-style interface that makes it simple for developers to create and manage virtual experiment packages. }> ST4SD Registry provides strong versioning capabilities by rigorously tracking changes to virtual experiment packages. This enhances reproducibility which is critical in scientific research.
## Try it yourself Download a package from the ST4SD Global Registry via `stp`. `pip install "st4sd-runtime-core[develop]"` then execute: ```bash stp package download https://registry.st4sd.res.ibm.com/registry-ui/experiment/nanopore-geometry-experiment ``` If you have an ST4SD Cloud instance, you can log in to your ST4SD Registry via `stp` and push the package to it: ```bash ST4SD_AUTHENTICATION_ROUTE=$(oc get route st4sd-authentication -o=jsonpath={.spec.host}) stp login $ST4SD_AUTHENTICATION_ROUTE stp package push nanopore-geometry-experiment.json ``` Then visit the URL `stp` outputs to see the experiment in your ST4SD Registry UI. ## Learn more
}> Learn about all the features of the ST4SD Registry UI with a [guided tour](/using-the-virtual-experiments-registry-ui) or visit the [ST4SD Global Registry](https://registry.st4sd.res.ibm.com/) for a first look. }> Use [an interactive Build Canvas and a Graph Library](/build-experiments-registry-ui) to create and modify experiments straight from your browser. }> Learn all that `stp` has to offer and how it can help you when using ST4SD in its [dedicated page](/stp). }> We've distilled many years of experience in creating virtual experiments into a set of [developer best-practices](/virtual-experiment-developer-best-practices).
## Explore other ST4SD technologies
}> **ST4SD Core** enables writing virtual experiments that can run on your laptop, on HPC machines, or on cloud. [Get Started](/st4sd-core-getting-started) }> **ST4SD Cloud** creates and maintains, secure, scalable and robust deployments of ST4SD on OpenShift clusters. [Get Started](/st4sd-cloud-getting-started) }> **ST4SD Services** allows scientists to run virtual experiments and query their data via Jupyter notebooks. It includes a high-performance metadata-store that enables memoization. [Get Started](/st4sd-services-getting-started)
